Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul7236
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Room was excellent, really spacious and clean. Great views of the sea from our room. It was 15 minutes to walk to the Lido vaporetto stop but this was a pleasant walk. Great to stay a little way out of Venice but really easy to travel into Venice. Food was excellent, the pizzas were huge and tasted delicious. Very reasonably priced food and drinks also. Breakfast also good. I would definately stay here again - loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't want to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey M
Reviews.Content: Positives: Large rooms Great views Comfortable beds Many TV channels On Lido Beach Rooftop terrace offering view of both Venice & the Adriatic Sea Great breakfast Negatives: ferry from Maestre to Lido (3 people + car) was 32 euro each way :/ - not the fault of the hotel, but a cost we hadn't expected. Very, very happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: johnm1951
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent, room larger than expected and very clean with view over the beach from one window and across the lagoon towards St Marcs from another. Would recommend a visit

Reviews.Title: “Best pizza ever”
Reviews.Author: alexe1966
Reviews.Content: The venezia 2000 is a very nice hotel in front of the beach in the same building there is also the pizzeria 2000 who is the best pizzeria i have ever being to

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Lezli W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and I am so glad it was. The whole experience of staying in the Lido and not on the main island made the trip an adventure. We explored the lagoons and canals by using the vaporato (water bus) and enjoyed everything about the experience. I have never smiled so much as venice really does take your breath away! but Burano is where we want to live. The Venezia 2000 was a lovely hotel to come home to in the evening, all the staff were wonderful but one enhanced our time there by making our evenings very enjoyable with his company as we exchanged stories and shared jokes.You know who you are!! The room was large enough and very clean and the food in the resturant was great, the service was excellent with very pleasent male/female staff and the wine perfect. We didn't take a lot of pictures as we deciced venice is a different experience for every one and ours is the memory of a wonderful honeymoon. Thank you we will be back! J & L Wylie

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Tadine W
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days, Staff was friendly, rooms were clean close to the beach and not far from shopping. Do not have Ice or Vending machine, the only american channel you get is CNN. All in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravellers44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late October. I was intially unsure about staying away from Venice but with an excellent public transport system this proved to be no problem. The hotel itself is almost the perfect embodiment of a three star: good but not great. The rooms are comfortable and the furnishings are modern and well kept. Beds a decent size although the matresses a little hard. Bathrooms are decent, with modern fittings but no bath. No in room internet although this is available for free in the lobby. A few of the things we enjoyed about this hotel were: the restaurant - probably the best value we had during our stay; the happy hour which offered an excellent start to the evening; breakfast - a good choice and of good quality. As other reviewers have said - take bus B to Piazzale Roma not to Malamocco - otherwise you'll have an interesting diversion to a pretty village at the other end of the island from where you need to be. The bus stops right outside the hotel in both directions and is a 3 minute journey to the vaporetta stop. Take line 1 to get to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: HK_Mac_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for our 3 night stay in Venice. Not being on the main island was not a problem - frequent water buses and land bus makes it easy to get from hotel to St Marks. We were there at the end of Sept and it seemed a bit quiet in the hotel and on the beach. Room was very comfortable and had a lovely view out to sea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Beccicorni17
Reviews.Content: Amazing holiday at this hotel, we went in December so it was pretty quiet, had nice sea view, dont think we even requested this, breakfast buffett was nice, and we had dinner there 1 night and that was good too. Bed was so comfy, beautiful bathroom! Huge umberellas for free came in very useful and staff were very helpful and spoke fantastic english. Being on the Lido meant it was a bit of a joureny to the main sights, but to be honest i love ridding on the bus boats so much i kind of liked doing this at least twice a day :) Would stay here again in a flash, amazing value!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Not a great location...for people who want to see Venice city”
Reviews.Author: Ka T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I read great reviews about this hotel, however I didn't know it will be so off the center it's actually on the different island from Venice and it cost us 90 euros to come by taxi, there are public transportation but if you come for the first time to see the city you don't want to travel everyday 30 min to the center, plus waiting for the public boat, for people who came there to relax on the beach and are not planing to visit city its probably perfect location because its right next to the beach, there is a lot of restaurants and places to eat near by. Also, as we have learned there is transportation strike every month for about one day so transportation is not running that well and we happened to be there during strike, not the best of luck. The hotel itself looks very nice on the outside, clean and staff are trying to be nice, however rooms were small and they put us below 1st floor, like basement floor where you look through window and see ground and car wheels and I didn't really like that I would prefer nice view it was our honeymoon so I asked staff to change our room to at least 1st or 2nd floor and they made such a big deal telling me that if you want nice view you need to specify it and pay extra....no when i was booking there is no way to specify it and prices were all the same I just can't understand how can you build hotel and expect people to pay for the rooms located in basement and we were not in summer season it was beginning of October so I'm sure they could have given us a nicer room but I'm assuming they wanted us to pay extra or something so I was not too happy with that hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value outside the hectic pace of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Av8ir2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an extra day and a half to spend in the Venice area before flying home from our European honeymoon, and found this wonderful hotel on the island of Lido.The staff was simply amazing. From getting us beach towels and holding our luggage before the official check-in time, to have a small breakfast bag for us when we checked out at 5am to catch the Ferry back to Venice for our 7:30am train departure to Milan. The room was big and spacious, much like an American hotel. The bathroom was very nice also. The bed was comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody staying in Lido, that wants to get away from the hustle of Venice. The public beach area is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: AT81192
Reviews.Content: Little late in reviewing but better late than never! My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a total of 5 days and it was the easiest part of our entire trip in Venice. The hotel is not on the main islands but that is one of its better qualities: it's very easy to find (Lido seems to only have 2 main roads), compared to the rest of our time spent on the main islands where we seemed to get lost every 5 minutes (we felt very sorry for fellow travelers dragging around their suitcases trying to find their hotels). It's also very accessible by the water taxis and they run well into the early hours of the morning so you never have to fear missing the last boat home. The staff were very friendly and very accommodating, as were the people on the island. We were warned by other travelers that Venetians are quite rude, yet everywhere we went people were only more than happy to help us. For the water taxis we were given a discount and metro cards to get into places for cheap because we're under 30 (just go to the kiosk at the taxi stop and ask, they're very friendly). The breakfasts are a little boring, but you can always make it up with lunch and dinner. There's a selection of meat, cheese, bread, jams/spreads, fruit and hard boiled eggs. The room was very clean, and comfy. We had a great view of the beach, and the bathroom was very spacious with a good shower! The mini bar did look like it hadn't been restocked in a while, but then I never eat stuff from the mini bars anyway, we just used it to keep our bottled water cold. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice. It's clean, comfy, cheap, the staff are very nice, and easy to locate. Great way to relax after spending all day on your feet seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: wingnut_11
Reviews.Content: my mum and i took my daughter to venice for her 21st birthday. what a great time we had, the hotel was perfect for us . the staff very helpful and friendly, facilities were good, the prices in the bar were very good . its very relaxing after spending the day in the center, only takes about 8 mins to get there on the water taxi. the beach is lovely and the sea warm and clean. our room was excellent we were in 101 it had a hugh terrace. could not fault this hotel and will be going back. its a 3 star and wasnt expensive.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING...PLEASE READ THIS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen s
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel after a long drive from Cannes...They had very kindly let our room go to someone else even though it had been booked and paid for earlier on in the week...How bad is that!!!!! They offered us a suite......that turned out to be half of a converted garage out the back yard of the hotel. The other half of the garage.(.which was disgusting by the way and seemed to have no visable windows unless i missed them...) was occupied by what seemed to be the caretaker...in his vest, plus his wife i presume and a very nasty loud barking dog which ran at us...The "suite" was a disgrace and could not be called an hotel room even...The photos on the internet site are of lovely rooms which encouraged us to book.. Maybe they exist.. we certainly didn't see one at all.. The whole experience was totally surreal!!!!.. we of course didn't stay and demanded our money back.. Hopefully we may get it, who knows...Also cost us 78 Euro on the ferry for a round trip that lasted less than 2 hours...If anyone is crazy enough to book this hotel I think that they would be needing to be certified...This is a genuine comment!! We have travelled the world Australia, the caribbean, Europe, America to name a few places and this was the worst experience ever..We had to find another hotel at a late hour in the day which was difficult in August but we were lucky enough to do so..So beware if you are offered ROOM 98!!! IT IS THE GARAGE !!!!!! SERIOUSLY....

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with some luxury touches”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: We booked this Venice Lido hotel about 2 months in advance via Superbreaks. We had planned a touring holiday of Italy and required 2 nights at a Venice hotel. We booked one double and one twin room for us and our 2 teenage daughters. The hotel is advertised as 3 star, but the location, service and bedrooms are definately higher than most other 3 star hotels. Location right on the beach frount of this elegent Venice Island, away from the hustle and bustle. Bedrooms and bathrooms had recently been refurbished to very high level. Hotel staff very efficient friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bilko13
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, no negative comments whatsoever. Room spacious, very clean, everything worked. Staff friendly and helpful. Very good food. Beach 2 mins, vaporetto terminal 10 min walk (or bus stop right outside the hotel). . Hot tub and sun loungers on roof terrace although not in use in March. . We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “OK but be aware of the fob off's”
Reviews.Author: Hilary1CoClare
Reviews.Content: We had arrived by taxi to the hotel which cost â‚¬15 for approx 1km for the main Vaporetta terminal, so folks I would not bother, extortion! My partner and I arrived at the hotel at approx 23.30 hours to be hold there was a problem with our room as there had been a leak and the room was not fit for use. I enquired if I could view this room as I am only too aware of the stories that are told when in fact the hotel is over booked. The gentleman on duty was polite and said that we could not see the room, I insisted but he would not show the room. I then questioned him about the room being in use and he appeared to get a little agitated. I requested to speak with the manager to be told that she was not on duty. I did speak with the alleged â€œrestaurant managerâ€� but he did not want to deal with our dilemma. The night porter then telephoned the hotel manager for me to speak with directly, but all go was a barrage of excuses down the phone and I did not get the opportunity to speak.... I do not believe she came up for air! Having had no success we were packed off to another hotel, of which they kept advising was a 4* and they were paying for a taxi to get there, the same taxi driver that dropped us off, he as was not as polite this time round though. We were then advised that we could check in the next day at 14.00 hours, to which I got angry, as we were supposed to be checked in from the previous day, it meant we had to check out of the other hotel at 10.00 hours and hang around until 14.00 hours to check into our original hotel to which I was not happy at all with. It does make you wonder as to what the problem with our room was if it could be available for use from 14.00 hours the next day.... I will leave that for you to ponder on? Book out policy is that you try to contact the client to advise that there is problem, having booked via a travel agent who had all contact details, they would have been able to contact advising of same. This would have been annoying but we have been able to go directly to the other hotel on arrival as it was late. I would have thought that this would be standard procedure, as a seasoned traveller this is how it should be handled, at least for warned if for armed. When we got back to the hotel on next day the advised that they had given us an upgraded room, it was an adequate 3* double room and could not see how they could call it an upgrade. Given that I the room was very comfortable, clean and the shower room was excellent. The only negative feedback I would give is the TV is not position in suitable place to view it, should you which to watch TV. Breakfast, be ready to get bored as we were there for 7 days and it did not change, with the exception for the first morning where we had breakfast at a different property. There was a real lack of variety. I have always believed that the Italians love their coffee but breakfast coffee leaves a lot to be desired. This did not give us the desire to use their dining facilities again so I am unable to comment on any other facilities. The staff were friendly and polite, with the exception of the very rude manager on the telephone on the arrival night. The hotel is a good 3* property but beware that it is a little remote and in an area that needs a little attention. It is quiet, when the kiosk bar across the road stops playing music, but this only seems to be louder at weekends. A note on general findings about Venice as a location, when dining in restaurants beware that there is cover charge to pay normally â‚¬2 per person and then a service charge of 12.5% to pay on the overall cost of the meal. Buy a Vaporetta ticket from the Kiosk at the airport if planning on travelling by Vaporetta, it really is worth the â‚¬50 per person per week. You can use this to see the other small islands and we had wonderful day trips to Murano & Burano (delightful) along with doing the normal sightseeing of main island of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Brussels1200
Reviews.Content: The Venezia 2000 hotel is simply a very good hotel. For us, it was more than a 3 stars hotel. Perfectly situated in front of a large beach. The hotel is beautiful, confortable, rooms are very clean and modern with new furniture, bathroom and especially the shower very relaxing, and the breakfast is very rich in choices, We would definitely return for our next trip to Venise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JulMcCenzie
Reviews.Content: I went there with my boyfriend and another couple. we wanted to stay somewhere outside the city, so we chose the hotel which looked best and had the best prize. well, it was fantastic. the beach was right in front of our door. breakfast was, well...italian. not the best, but okay. you should definetly get your morning coffe later, when you're in the city. dinner was nice. the have great wine there. some families, some couples. it wasn't noisy. free internet acess. bedrooms modern, with tv and minibar (expensive though), the bathroom was FABULOUS, they must have renovated it lately, the whole hotel is really modern and comfy. we loved it and will definetly stay there again. we had to go some time to catch the ferry to the actual city, (hotel's at "lido") but we liked those short trips too. all in all we had some wonderful time in venice, the city itself did the most part of that....it's just SO beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in an average location”
Reviews.Author: LongTalker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern, although far from luxurious. We had high expectations of our sea view room, however the sea was barely visible from our 2nd floor room, and there was no balcony, although to be fair, the hotel manager responded to our booking.com note by saying he *will* try to give us a room with a balcony, but that the cannot promise it. Breakfast was good, and in a nice dining hall. The person who was at the Reception when we checked in on the evening of 9th June was less then helpful and very iritable. Also, it took them three attempts at creating an account for us before we could use the (wired, not WiFi) Internet, and then only the first 30 minutes were free.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelCouple2513
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything we can ask for. We had a lovely room with a cute terrace. The solarium was fantastic. It was just 10mins walk from the boat station. Very friendly staff. Cant ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: AbigailMay06
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is that it was close to the beach. I meant to book a hotel right in Venice, but didn't realize this hotel is on the island off of Venice. It was fine, but you have to take a taxi boat there ($6 euros). However, once we got to the hotel, we were able to go hang out at the beach, which is right across from the hotel. It was very nice. The breakfast was included and it was pretty decent. The room was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody informed us we could not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyFlying6
Reviews.Content: No one informed us we could not keep our reservation until after we came to the hotel. We only had one day in Venice and wanted to make the most of our time. However, when we arrived at Venezia 2000, we were told that our room, along with two others, had toilette problems, and we have been booked in the Viktoria Palace Hotel instead. I said that I was unhappy that I was not called or email beforehand, so that we would know to go straight to the other hotel, or to make alternative plans. We were given a free drink at the bar and taxi to the second hotel. We were told numerous times that the second hotel was 4 stars, and therefore better. We were told the hotels are owned by the same company. The Viktoria Palace Hotel was not a good experience. It was not located on the beach, like Venezia 2000. We could not rent bikes. It was a far walk from anything. Also, when we asked for the bar, we were told there was no bar. When we saw that there was a bar, we were told that there was no one to pour our drinks. The only good thing was the wireless internet. The absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced in a hotel was the response to our television not working. When we first checked in, I asked a housekeeper how to use the tv. She realized it was broken and called reception to fix it. We waited a half hour, and then went out for the day, expecting it to be fixed when we returned. When we returned, the television was still not working. We asked the gentlemen at reception to fix it. They came and pressed a bunch of buttons and then started walking out. I asked if it was fixed and they said "No, it's broken." They were just going to leave without saying anything. We asked if they were going to offer to change our room to one with a working television, or offer anything to make up for the television not working, and they said "No, sorry" and left. I wanted to stay at Venezia 2000 based on the reviews given on this site, but the lack of communication and the transfer to a poor quality hotel did not leave us satisfied. What "four-star" hotel has outdated televisions which won't turn on, and receptionists who ignore problems? Luckily, Venice is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: 4pack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March 2011. Room had sea/beach view and was to a high standard and I LOVED the shower!. I can't praise the staff enough ..... sooooo helpful. Bar staff all spoke English, the Concierge was very helpful and the Chambermaids greeted us with beaming smiles each day. We got a 72 hr transport ticket (â‚¬33 each) that includes ALL transport methods: bus, waterbus, and trains. The buses run from the Hotel down to the Vaparetto (?) jetty every 20 minutes from 15 mins past the hour. Cafes/Bars can be expensive. e.g. a glass of wine in the hotel : â‚¬2.50 whereas a tiny cafe in St Marks Square: â‚¬6.50 !! A gondola trip was offered to us at â‚¬100 but he eventually opted for â‚¬80.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a sight-seeing young couple!”
Reviews.Author: Mohalloran7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel basically because it was dirt cheap. Based on that we weren't expecting a massive deal. I have to say we were pleasantly suprised by this place. It is a little hard to find from the ferry stop, about a 10 minute walk across to the other side of the lido - carrying our cases we were a little worried that we were too far away from anything! However, when we arrived the receptionist was very friendly. The public areas of the hotel were well kept and clean - our room was also clean, if a little run-down (the walls needed a lick of paint) The bathroom was modern and clean with a nice shower. The location of the hotel didn't turn out to be much of a problem, it was nice to have a stroll over to the ferry stop everyday, and you can buy a 3 day ticket for all the ferry's (like a travelcard) The boat ride over to Venice proper took about another 10 mins. We actually ate in the hotel most nights, the food tasted good and was typically priced for Venice. The breakfasts were standard, bread, toaster, cheese, ham, sweetbread, jams and spreads etc. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would definately consider it again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you any sleep”
Reviews.Author: mai14cc
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at this hotel if you want any sleep during your stay. We booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor's reviews and it was a total nightmare!! We did not get any sleep during our 4 days/3 nights stay at this hotel. The first night they put us in a "nonsmoking" room which was filled with cigaratte smell. Even though we requested to change room right away, they had us wait till the next day. I was 3 months pregnant and had our 22 months old daughter with us. Having to stay in a filthy room with the cigaratte smell was unbearable. On top of this, there were lots of "big" mesquitos and spiders that we were trying to fight off through out the night. These mesquitos were so "big" that when you smash it, you'll see a lof of blood coming out from previous victims (not a pretty picture). Aftern switching to the new room, we realized the air conditioner doesn't work. We decided not to bother front desk again as they're not that nice/friendly. At night is when we realizd thhe biggest problem in this main building rooms, there is no sound proof for the rooms at all, zero. So, you will hear people who get in late and wants to stay up late talking, people who get up early to go out, you name it. You will hear everything in your neighbor's rooms throughout the night. We didn't get any sleep during our stay here and had a hard time sight seeing during the day due to lack of sleep. Once we got to our next hotel, we decided to take a day off from doing anything so we could catchup on our sleep. There is more disappointing things to mention but the biggest problem we had here was SLEEPLESS nights.

Reviews.Title: “Venice sight-seeing and a beach: what more could you wish for?”
Reviews.Author: Spaldingtyner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed on the Lido: 10 minutes walk to the water-bus and 2 minutes to the beach. The rooms are basic, clean and air-conditioned. There is a useful roof-top solarium which we had to ourselves most of the time. Continental breakfast buffet was plentiful but unexciting. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. The excellent vaporetti waterbus service made this an excellent base for visiting Venice - highly recommended. We bought 7 day unlimited use passes which could also be used on land buses on the Lido and for the bus to/from the airport. This works out cheaper than using the Alialguna ferry but it does take longer. To get from the airport to the hotel take the Number 5 bus to the bus station at Piazzale Roma, then take either a number 1 or 2 vaporetti to Lido. (1 stops at every stop and takes longer but is a great was to travel along the Grand Canal and see the sights) At the Lido vaporetti stop take either a B or G bus - both stop outside the hotel â€“ alternatively a taxi from the vaporetti stop to the hotel cost 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for beach / city break combo”
Reviews.Author: Currie_McCormick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends last June. Great hotel, service was exceptional. Rooms small but adequate. Biggest bonus was big terrace with sun beds on the roof where we crashed after a day's sightseeing, or if we didn't plan to spend long on the beach. Beach just opposite hotel, great Italian family atmosphere. Hotel has 2 rows at front of private beach available for guest rental. 10 minute walk to vaporetto to venice proper. Wonderful views of Venice from the rooftop terrace at sundown. Bikes available to borrow - but get there early if you want a decent one as some of them were pretty ramshackle.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money , nice location”
Reviews.Author: sachintravelling
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute deal for this hotel and were afraid how it will turn out but it was one of the good decisions , this hotel is really nice , very windy as it is opp to sea, well maintained and very comfortable On reaching lido u need to walk for 10 min to reach this place , rooms are small but very cozy , we got a corner room open on both sides and you get very good views of sea from the room. The breakfast offered was also good and hotel have cycle on rent , try exploring lido on cycle it will be fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel on Lido”
Reviews.Author: Sandra35091
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is located on Lido, and easily accessible to Venice by vapporati boats. The bus stops right in front of the hotel, making it very easy to get to restaurants, the boat dock and anywhere on Lido. A quiet location right on the beach. Big, beautiful rooms and bathrooms. Very helpful staff. Good breakfast included in price of stay. Free internet access. In Venice, take the #1 boat from beginning to end. It goes right down the Grand Canal and you can see all of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel on Lido away from mad Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Natrah76
Reviews.Content: We stayed last October and to be honest, I was slightly apprehensive as we were not on the Venice island itself - BUT we were so pleased to be away from the hustle and bustle after a long day of sightseeing, this hotel and its location proved to be an oasis of calm. Rooms are comfy, breakfast adequate (and lots!) I would say the sun terrace needs an refurb but still we managed to sunbathe (even in Oct!). Highlight of our stay (apart from our visits to magical Venice, Murano and Baruno islands) was to hire a couple of the mountain bikes from the hotel to explore the Lido island (found amazing deli at the other end of island) and was also able to take the bikes for the day on a ferry to a neighbouring island - Punta Sabbioni, where we found the most amazing resturant that served the best seafood pasta EVER! You will find this place on route to the beach - I think its called Franco's? :-)

Reviews.Title: “relaxing away from the hub of venice but close enough to enjoy all it has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: moohon
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean but seemed a little dark as we were facing out of the back of the hotel. However this meant it was quiet despite being situated next to the stairwell. Lovely rooms with bedroom, living area and bathroom. Nice sized bath with two ends. Always a bonus for honeymoon! There was a mini bar but disappointingly no tea making facilities. Staff were all pleasant. Breakfast's were lovely with all that you need to set you up for the day. Easy access to town with buses. Arriving at the boat depot get B bus to outside hotel and A to go back. Worthwhile getting a weekly ticket which allows you to use on buses and vaparettos. Jacuzzi and air conditioning were good when they eventually got turned on as we were on borderline off season. Lovely to have beach so close. Thoroughly recommend for price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem”
Reviews.Author: JazzyKaz
Reviews.Content: Unless you insist on being right where the action is in Venice, the location of this hotel is brilliant. It suited our style of travelling to a T. It's nice to get away from the maddening crowds of Venice and come back "home" to the much slower paced Lido. Pleasant to walk to the Vaporetto and just a short boat ride away. The Hotel itself was fairly elegant. The rooms looked like they were recently upgraded and modern. We had no noise issues from other rooms at all. Staff was very nice and friendly. Reception was helpful with requests. My security deposit box wasn't working properly. They had someone there to look at it within 5 minutes. The breakfast was better than average for continental Italian style. I can't see any reason not to stay here unless you really want to be in Venice, possibly overlooking a canal, or you have difficulty with mobility and the walk and vaporetto ride just isn't for you. We ate in the restaurant only once and it wasn't anything special. Better places on the walk to the water taxi. For us, we loved being on the Lido and this hotel was above our expectations. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: slinkytwink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the bank holiday weekend. It is a lovely place to stay spotless and the staff were lovely. However the only problem we had was the noise coming from the room upstairs. I don't think they were being noisy on purpose you couldn't heard chatting but we could hear the pounding of feet everytime they walked round the room and something rattling I think the wardrobe was wobbling everytime they moved. Also it sounded like there was rain everytime someone had a shower. It was a shame as it did disturb our stay somewhat waking us up with the noise. Lido itself is very nice and quiet it is very easy to get the water boat into Venice. When you arrive at the airport get a travel card we got the 3 day pass we then caught the number 5 to Venice and there are a number of water buses to Lido from there. We had a fantastic time it was just a shame about the lack of sleep from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay when you are in Venice”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds9187
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews here at trip advisor. And at the end we were glad that we did book this hotel! Thanks to the reviewers (who take time for writing a review) for that! The hotel is perfect to stay. The service at the hotel is great. When we came, we were warmly received at the reception. The staffs were nice and friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nice. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was good too. Bath tub could have been a bit bigger. There is also a small tv in the room. But for some strange reasons you have to go to reception to get the remote. You can also use internet (there is only computer at the lounge next to reception) free for 30 minutes. Location of the hotel is perfect. The city center is just a 15 minutes walk from the hotel. But there is a bus stop right outside the hotel if you prefer taking bus. The Lido beach is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant in hotel so donÂ´t know how the food is there. But the restaurants you find in the center are great. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was very good (not much choices though). Overall this is a great hotel to stay at a reasonable price. If your budget is tight and looking for a cheap and yet excellent place to stay, this is the one for you! Go for it and you wonÂ´t regret!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Toby6859
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in winter. Nice quiet location opposite the Lido beach, with a bus stop outside the hotel which drops you off at the vaporetto, or about a 20 minute stroll past shops & restaurants but within easy reach of Venice & the other islands. Continental breakfast..so no bacon & eggs , but plenty to choose from. We had a big double room with a sofa & a good sized bathroom with bath & shower...last time we only had a shower (great shower, really powerful) & a smaller room, but still comfortable. All the staff are polite & helpful except for one older man in the restaurant who is rude, unapproachable & hasn't got a clue about customer service! The view from the roof is great...the beach on one side & right across the lagoon to St Marks on the other side. I would definately recommend this hotel & wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great view”
Reviews.Author: portofanny
Reviews.Content: We arrived after running the venice marathon. It was great relaxing on the rooftop where you could see the sunset over venice. The room was clean and well kept, I was ill for a couple of days with a virus, and the hotel were very helpful. No complaints at all. The breakfast was good, but coffee from a machine was a let down. The restaurant is run independantly and is run by a grumpy man, who wouldnt give us a cup for our room!!. All in all the hotel is a pleasant way to stay on the lido and is close enough to venice to travel to and from with little cost.

Reviews.Title: “trouble free and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: fiat500cc
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and all spoke english to ask any questions about the hotel, venice and information on the water buses. The hotel is a 10-15min walk from the ferry station but there is a bus (Route B every 20 mins but only til 2030). The room we had was very fresh and was immaculately cleaned everyday with good towels changed if you wanted. The restaurant had a good menu but your better going up to the main street opposite the ferry station where there is much greater choice. The only real let down was that there was only coffee from a machine available at breakfast but the breakfast buffet compensated.

Reviews.Title: “near lido beach with extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FillyFragile
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with friendly staff next to lido beach. Only negative thing was the location...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, handy for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Steviec55
Reviews.Content: Although this was a bit of a nightmare break for us, it was not the fault of the hotel which was pleasant enough with friendly helpful staff. It was clean and tidy. Our room was quite small but adequate with no balcony although there were others that had balconies. Breakfast was limited and basic of the continental type. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening for dinner. Our problems began when our British Airways flight took off leaving ninety per cent of everybody's luggage behind after the belts in the airport broke down. We were advised by the cabin crew that if we left forwarding details the luggage would be sent on by taxi to our respective hotels. We complied with this request and waited in vain for our case to arrive. Topping up on essentials as we went.. We flew out on Thursday and by Sunday (our return day) it still hadn't arrived. On returning to Venice airport we made enquiries and it transpired that our luggage was there and that we should have made a lost luggage claim when we arrived. However the staff there were helpful and our case was returned to us so that we could take it home with us. The moral of this story is, not to believe everything you are told by cabin crew staff and make your own enquiries. We will know better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & great value”
Reviews.Author: Mairead_02
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel if you would like to get away from the hectic tourism in Venice. It doesn't take long on the Vaporetto and the views are great along the way! The hotel was great value for this standard. Our room was clean and very spacious along with a large, modern bathroom. Breakfast was good, standard continental. The hotel is directly across from the beach and have a roof terrace. We mostly ate on the Lido as was more reasonable than Venice. I would definately recommend this restaurant 'Ristorante Parco delle Ros'. We went there a few times and it was excellent, traditional menu, great food and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, very affordable off-season”
Reviews.Author: chiaraSofia
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel in March 2009. I was really amazed to find something that cheap (55 EUR double room, internet rate) in Venice so expected something a bit crappy. I was surprised to find, however, a very clean, nice, excellently located hotel! Spacious rooms (no terrace :( ), renovated bathroom, view to the sea! A bus stop just in front of the hotel. Car parking inside, nice garden. The so-called Lido island is accessible with their water transport, and ferry, we were 5 mins from the main square by water, and at a very good location to access all other popular islands. The staff was very polite, there was free internet in the lobby. The restaurant was good, though didn't like the service so much. If I go again to Venice off-season, would definitely stay in this hotel again. The prices during high season were announced to be 150 EUR though...which seems a bit high to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money ,great location,helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: bluesmoke123
Reviews.Content: I was there with my girlfriend, the hotel is not on Venice city but on the island of Lido very closed to the beach. . We really appriciated the calm of the Lido after a day in the very crowded street of Venice ( the boat trip from venice to the lido take about 15min). The hotel was very clean, we had a room with a private terrace wich was a good plus. The staff were very helpfull, specially Secondina . I will definitly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good base for Venice holiday.”
Reviews.Author: johnboy77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because it was very good value compared to what you'd get for the price in actual Venice itself. Getting to the island of Lido is no problem at all, when you arrive at Marco Polo airport, i strongly recommend you get a 2 or 3 day travel pass, they allow you to get as many buses and boats as you want, without the hassle of paying each time, ans also save you a lot of money. Get the number 5 ACTV bus just outside the teminal, its a 25 min journey into Venice. Then from there get the number 51 ACTV vaporetto(Boat) straight to the Lido. A word of warning, the map on the hotel's website shows where the car ferry lands at the Lido, NOT where this number 51 boat lands, which is what most likely you'll be on. To save yourself the stress of walking in the wrong direction, i recommend getting a taxi to the hotel when you first arrive, then you can see how to get from the hotel to the waterstop, because the hotel isn't that easy to find. The hotel itself is fairly nice, staff are helpful and the rooms are a good size and spotless. The walls are very thin and we had noisy people next door, we could hear everything. I found the beds uncomfortable too. The restaurant is pricey when all service charges and taxes are included, but then so is everywhere in Venice! Overall it's a good base for a short trip to Venice, and good value too.

Reviews.Title: “What you need to know”
Reviews.Author: JdeP
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews, I'll try to explain why some people had a less-than-ideal experience. Location The hotel is NOT near central Venice, which some people may find to be a drawback, but is in fact a benefit unless you are trying to see all of Venice in 2 days (which is crazy): by staying here you are away from the noise and the tourists. It is a quiet location, set back from street with very little traffic. Transport to central Venice Unless you are very elderly or very unfit, it will not take more than 12 minutes to walk from the hotel to the vaporetto (water-bus) stop. But there is a bus-stop DIRECTLY outside the hotel, with a bus every 20 minutes, that runs very punctually, so it is very easy to walk out of the hotel, wait a couple of minutes for the bus, and be at the vaporetto 5 mins later. The vaporetto service is also punctual, with several different routes to central Venice and other islands, so if you make a note of the timetables, you should never had to wait more than a few minutes. And if you do? Hey, you;re on vacation, take it easy and watch the locals going about their business! Rooms I visited with two friends -- we all had very nice rooms. They each had a view of the sea, I had a courtyard-facing room with a large balcony with a table, chairs, and sun-loungers. The decor was recent and in good condition throughout. My only complaint was that that I had noisy neighbours one night, and realised that the walls are too thin. Staff We found the reception staff to be helpful (for example they were happy to phone a restaurant for us, to make reservations in Italian). Price Whether or not you think this place is good value will depend on what you pay. I would strongly recommend visiting Venice out-of-season, when there are far fewer tourists, and absolute bargains can be had. The official room-rate was something like 260 Euros per night, but in late November we paid 35 Euros per night! Restaurant and Breakfast We did not eat in the restaurant in the evening, so I can't comment, but the breakfast was average or above-average, with a wide choice of croissants, breads, cold meats, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great base for Venice city break”
Reviews.Author: IRONGIRLOF12
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights at end of October '08. easy to check in. helpful staff. clean room. large, comfy bed. Shower room was great, well above my expectations. we also had a large balcony. TV was mainly italian channels but a couple of Uk ones. mini bar was too tempting we had a mini bottle of bubbly and a beer for 8 euros. Bus stop outside goes right into the main street and to vaporetto stop. you can walk, but we did enohgt of that around Venice. Some okay places to eat along the main street, selling pizza/pasta /ice-creams etc also a supermarket and tourist shops. We ate in the hotel restuarant on our last night, we had bruchetta, lasagna, pizza and dessert. food was good/okay but the desserts were frozen/shop bought variety. Buffet breakfast was again okay: croissants, ham, salami, cheese, bread rolls, cornflakes, coco-pops, fruit salad, boiled eggs. kept us going until lunch. Husband used the internet once. Overall I would say this is a good base and a lot cheaper than staying in Venice itself. It only took 10-15 mins to reach Venice by Vaporettto.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: VLEUS
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my 4 days stay in Venice after reading the good reviews it had in tripadvisor. My experience was not that good, although not too bad either. First of all, if you choose to walk from the vaporetto stop to the hotel, it's not 10 minutes, but a 20. It's true that you have a bus stop in front of the hotel, and you can take the bus every 20 minutes. It takes only about 3 minutes from the hotel to the vaporetto stop by bus. When we arrived to the place, they gave me probably the worst room in the hotel, next to the parking lot! It looked terrible and we felt unsafe being outside. I had to complain and ask for another room. Fortunately, I could get another room that was quite ok. We were there on September 15, 2008. Weather was not bad, but when the sun goes down it's cold in Venice. So when we arrived to our room, we felt it was cold there too. We tried to switch on the heater and it didn't work. We tried then with the air conditioning unit, but it had only the option for cold air. We went to the reception and the man there told us: "It's September. No heater. If you cold, use the blanket that's inside the closet". Great answer! After that we tried to watch TV for a while. But there was no remote control. We had to go again to the reception, where the man gave us the control. I have to tell you, the staff is not what you could say "nice", but quite rude in general. Breakfast was nothing special, though not really bad. The liquid that they say is orange juice was impossible to drink, it was worse than Tang and the coffee came out of a vending machine! Undrinkable. At least they had tea bags and milk. The day we left the hotel, the clerk asked for the remote control, so we had to go back to the room to give it to him. What did he expect? That I was going to steal it or what? It wasnâ€™t even a universal control that you could use everywhere. Then something happened that I think was unacceptable. The clerk asked me: Did you have something from the minibar? I said no. After that, in front of me, he called the cleaning lady and ask her in Italian to check the minibar. I could understand it perfectly because I have studied Italian for two years. So the maid returned and said: "Everything's there", and the clerk told to me: "Ok, have a nice trip". Very, very inappropriate. So this is my experience. Did I have a bad time there? Not really. Could have been better? Yes, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel except restaurant”
Reviews.Author: felixtud
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,location is near beach and near Venice too (ten minutes by vaporeto). Friendly and very clean. Dislike: find another restaurant, the hotel restaurant has bad food and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Daniel40
Reviews.Content: The positives of this hotel are its location, a quiet seaside resort away from the milling tourists of Venice itself. The room was pleasant, clean and had a great shower. However, the negatives outway the positives I`m afraid. We arrived at 11.30 p.m. tired and thirsty only to find that the the guest room free coffee and tea making facilities described in the hotel information did not exist. After going to reception to enquire we were told in broken English that the restaurant was closed and we could only have coffee at breakfast . As we were on a budget being told to use the minibar was not acceptable. They offered us a kettle the next day which did not work. The language proved to be a problem several times and were not sure if the staff were being purposely difficult. They were not friendly in any way. The breakfast was appalling and after the first day we did not avail ourselves of it. The daytime receptionist was a perfect imitation of Basil Faulty and the restaurant in actual fact was a Pizza bar. So rather disappointing. I will say that the nightime receptionist proved invaluable at times and tried his best under difficult circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pear17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the best we have stayed in. Great location overlooking the beach to the front and a view across the water to Venice at the rear. Very clean and spacious room with a view to the beach. Ideally located with a 15 minute stroll to the vaporetto stop, I might add, along a wonderful stretch of restaurants and shops (ice cream parlours too!) The facilities also include a wonderful roof terrace with sun loungers, parasols and a bubbling cold water tub (so welcome on a hot day). Breakfast had a great choice with something for everybody. Staff very helpful. Free internet access available. Definitely, a hotel I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for summer”
Reviews.Author: NJC2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you are looking for a city break/beach holiday. Away from all the crowds in San Marco area, it's a ten minute walk to the ferry boat. A safe area, friendly staff and nice clean rooms. The restuarant wasn't great but there are lovely restaurants a five minute walk away. I would recommend this hotel in summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel and a bargain”
Reviews.Author: xj_me_leex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the lido which is ten minutes away from Venice on the water bus. It was very clean and better than i expected. It was rated as a 3 star but we were very suprised as i have stayed in hotels with 4 and 5 star ratings and this was just as nice. The breakfast was okay the usual continental buffet although there was not much choice. There are some nice restuarants, coffee shops, ice cream shops etc on the lido if you did not want to go into Venice everyday. There is a nice beach on the lido but we did not have the weather. would be nice in the summer. We had friends staying in the centre of venice and there hotel was just as nice as ours but they paid double what we did. For the sake of the 10 min walk to the water bus station(there was a bus avaliable) and the 10 min ride into venice on the water bus, it was well worth saving that extra money. Venice itself was nice, so many lovely places to see and also so much nice food to eat. avoid the water taxis as they are very overpriced and you can buy a travel card for the water busses, we had one that lasted 3 days which was te length of our stay.... one tip- stick to the italian food out there- obviously there speciality. we ate chinese one night- Big mistake. Overall we had a lovely stay. nice romantic little trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacqui22
Reviews.Content: The Venezia 2000 was in a great position being away from the hustle and bustle of Venice but only a 15minute walk or 2min bus ride to the ferry to all the main tourist attractions. It is right on the beach so if it wasnt soooooo cold it would have made a good beach holiday (thinking of going back in the summer). The staff were helpful and friendly, Including the cleaners! The breakfast was a bit boring in choice but not quantity, its worth saying that it has a good menu in the evening, and very reasonably priced. The room was beautiful and clean, although the luke warm or cold showers were a bit of a wake up!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, responsive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Carebear79
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice a few months back and enjoyed this hotel. Did have an apartment suite so difficult to judge standard rooms but it appears they give the overall hotel the same standard and attention as I had. There are generally lovely views over the Venice/canal side or the ocean on the other. There was a tv in the room although as is typical, had limited English channels. It was quite clean and the bed was of a good modern standard. Restaurant had good decent food at reasonable prices. Breakfast buffet was also good but not great variety. Shower in my ensuite had a difficult shower to negotiate, with sloped roof and no enclosure to prevent water getting everywhere. Overall though staff were friendly and responsive and it is charming decor. The lift was useful. Good hotel. 10-15 minute walk to ferry [waterbus] for main Venice although adequate restaurants on this side.

HotelInfo.Name: Venezia 2000 Hotel & Residence
HotelInfo.Address: Lungomare G D'Annunzio 2 | Venezia Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
